column4: hello, Im new to servers and I am barely starting. I want to know if it is possible to run ubuntu in live mode as if it would be a pc using a ubuntu server edition cd in a eserver x335?
The normal isos sure wont give you that option
well, is there something I could do?
you could try booting the normal desktop iso and installing apache to the ramdisk.
also try resising your main partition on the server with gparted to make room for a test install
well, I am having some problems since it is not similar to a pc, and I am doing my research...
not precisely I cannot find any option to boot from CD :S
server iso file doesn't have the option
I am trying with a desktop ISO
then its there, its called something like "try ubuntu without installing" or something to that effect.
thanks for your help, but I mean, I cannot find how to select the cdrom drive to boot first
well that beyond the area covered by this channel
your going to have to go to a channel thats dedicated to whatever hardware your using.
